intro: Stenogyne teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mesic forests and streamside areas. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Stenogyne teres plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
